measured_by: reaction time difference following loss or draw versus win trials
justification: The article states that “post-loss slowing is defined as increased decision time following losses relative to wins, and, post-loss speeding is defined as decreased decision time following losses relative to wins,” indicating that RT comparisons are the operational measure of this construct.

measured_by: proportion of shift behaviour in the Rock-Paper-Scissors task
justification: “Operant conditioning dictates the tendency to repeat action following success (win-stay) and the tendency to switch action following failure (lose-shift)… the degree of win-stay behaviour approximates the optimal proportion (33.3%), … the degree of lose-shift behaviour exceeds the optimal proportion (66.6%),” showing that shift-rate percentages are used to quantify behavioural flexibility.

topic_or_construct: Subjective impression of task controllability (luck vs skill)
measured_by: visual analogue scale from ‘total luck’ to ‘total skill’
justification: In Experiment 2, “Participants also reported their subjective impression of each condition along a visual analog scale from total luck to total skill,” specifying the VAS as the measurement tool for perceived controllability.

topic_or_construct: Outcome valence (positive vs negative nature of feedback)
justification: The introduction notes that “Feedback-related negativity (FRN)… is a reliable index of the positive or negative nature of trial outcome,” identifying FRN amplitude as the physiological measure of outcome valence.
